Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the frequency of officer assaults by stating that an officer was assaulted every 10 minutes, when the actual rate is closer to an assault every 10.3 minutes.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any specific data or evidence to back up the statement.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that all reported assaults on officers resulted in pain inflicted on the officer, which may not be the case for all incidents.
Understate: The claim may understate the rarity of ambush attacks on police officers, as they are described as rare occurrences.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the assaults, such as officers intervening in disturbances or effectuating arrests.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by using a statistic (crime clock) that is not considered a sound practice by experts.
